definition.text: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

examples.text: assure somebody that
Her doctor has assured us that she’ll be fine.
The document is genuine, I can assure you .
assure somebody of something
The dealer had assured me of its quality.

definition.text: to make something certain to happen or to be achieved

examples.text: Excellent reviews have assured the film’s success.
assure somebody (of) something
A win on Saturday will assure them of promotion to Division One.

definition.text: to check that something is correct or true

examples.text: assure yourself that
Tim waited a moment to assure himself that he was not being followed.
assure yourself of
I took steps to assure myself of her guilt.

definition.text: the amount of insurance money to be paid out when someone dies
a very small round mass of a liquid or sticky substance

examples.text: blob of
a blob of honey

definition.text: something that cannot be clearly seen, especially because it is far away

examples.text: Without a telescope, the comet will look like a fuzzy blob.

definition.text: a stupid person
a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together

examples.text: bunch of
I’ll send her a bunch of flowers.
He had a bunch of keys on his belt.
a bunch of grapes

definition.text: a group of people

examples.text: The ancient Egyptians were a clever bunch.
bunch of
a friendly bunch of people

definition.text: the best among a group of people or things

meaning.translation: بهترین در بین افرادی یا چیزهایی

definition.text: a large number of people or things, or a large amount of something

examples.text: bunch of
There’s a whole bunch of places I want to visit.

definition.text: if a girl wears her hair in bunches, she ties it together at each side of her head
to stay close together in a group, or to make people do this

examples.text: The children bunched together in small groups.
John stopped, forcing the rest of the group to bunch up behind him.

definition.text: to make part of your body tight, or to become tight like this

examples.text: Sean bunched his fists.

definition.text: to pull material together tightly in folds

examples.text: She bunched the cloth up and threw it away.

definition.text: to hold or tie things together in a bunch
if the top or sides of something cave in, they fall down or inwards

examples.text: on
The roof of the tunnel caved in on them.

definition.text: to finally stop opposing something, especially because someone has persuaded or threatened you

meaning.translation: افشا کردن چیزی را متوقف کردن

examples.text: to
The chairman is expected to cave in to pressure from shareholders.

definition.text: when the roof of something such as a mine falls in
when someone stops opposing something

meaning.translation: وقتی که شخصی افشای چیزی را متوقف می کند

definition.text: showing a lot of skill

examples.text: a great performance from a consummate actor
He won the race with consummate ease (= very easily ) .
De Gaulle conducted his strategy with consummate skill .

definition.text: used to emphasize how bad someone or something is

examples.text: his consummate lack of tact
The man’s a consummate liar.

definition.text: to make a marriage or relationship complete by having sex
to make something complete, especially an agreement
a set of clothes worn by an actor or by someone to make them look like something such as an animal, famous person etc

examples.text: the film’s lavish costumes and spectacular sets
Hallowe'en costumes

definition.text: clothes that are typical of a particular place or period of time in the past

meaning.translation: لباس هایی که مربوط به مکان خاص یا دوره زمانی خاصی در گذشته هستند

examples.text: The dancers were in national costume.
performers dressed in period costume (= the clothes of a period of history )

definition.text: a swimming costume
a line on a piece of cloth, paper etc where it has been folded, crushed, or pressed

examples.text: She smoothed the creases from her skirt.
I’ll have to iron out the creases.

definition.text: a fold in someone’s skin

examples.text: the creases on his forehead

definition.text: the line where the player has to stand to hit the ball in cricket
to become marked with a line or lines, or to make a line appear on cloth, paper etc by folding or crushing it

examples.text: Don’t sit on my newspaper. You’ll crease it!
These trousers crease really easily.
A worried frown creased her forehead.

definition.text: physically unable to hear anything or unable to hear well

examples.text: communication between deaf and hearing people
I think Mum’s going a bit deaf .
She’s deaf and dumb (= unable to hear or speak ) and communicates using sign language.
Tom was born profoundly deaf (= having great difficulty hearing ) .
stone deaf/deaf as a post(= completely deaf )

definition.text: people who are deaf

examples.text: a school for the deaf

definition.text: to be unwilling to hear or listen to something

meaning.translation: کر بودن (به معنی اینکه نخواهی چیزی را بشنوی)

examples.text: She was deaf to his pleas.

definition.text: to be unwilling to listen to what someone is saying or asking

examples.text: The factory owners turned a deaf ear to the demands of the workers.

definition.text: if advice or a warning falls on deaf ears, everyone ignores it
a hollow area in the surface of something, usually made by something hitting it

examples.text: dent in
There was a large dent in the passenger door.

definition.text: a reduction in the amount of something

examples.text: dent in
The trip made a big dent in our savings.
Eight years of effort have hardly put a dent in drug trafficking.

definition.text: if you dent something, or if it dents, you hit or press it so that its surface is bent inwards

meaning.translation: ضربه زدن/خوردن و یک فرورفتگی ایجاد کردن/شدن

examples.text: No one was injured, but the car was scratched and dented.

definition.text: to damage or harm something

examples.text: The scandal has dented his reputation.

definition.text: any substance that makes things dirty, such as mud or dust

meaning.translation: هر ماده ای که چیزها رو کثیف میکنه مثل گل یا گرد و خاک

examples.text: You should have seen the dirt on that car!
His face and hands were black with dirt.
a patch of grass, covered in dog dirt (= waste from a dog’s bowels )

definition.text: earth or soil

examples.text: Michael threw his handful of dirt onto the coffin.
in (the) dirt
The children had been sitting in the dirt.

definition.text: information about someone’s private life or activities which could give people a bad opinion of them if it became known

examples.text: The newspapers had been digging up dirt on the president.

definition.text: talk, writing, a film etc that is considered bad or immoral because it is about sex
to take money from your bank account

meaning.translation: پول بیرون کشیدن از حساب بانکی

definition.text: to make someone feel less shy and more willing to talk

meaning.translation: به کسی احساس راحتی دادن به این صورت که کمتر خجالت بکشد و بیشتر مایل به حرف زدن شود

examples.text: She just needed someone to draw her out and take an interest in her.

definition.text: to mention a particular piece of information and explain it clearly and in detail

meaning.translation: به اطلاعات خاصی اشاره کردن و آن را واضح و با جزییات توضیح دادن

examples.text: There are two major themes to be drawn out in this discussion.

definition.text: to make an event last longer than usual

meaning.translation: از حالت عادی طولانی تر کردن یک جلسه ، ملاقات و غیره

examples.text: The final question drew the meeting out for another hour.

definition.text: if the days or nights draw out, it stays light until later in the evening because summer is coming

meaning.translation: طولانی تر شدن روز یا شب

definition.text: ( Federal Insurance Contributions Act ) in the US, money which is taken from your pay by the government to be used for social security
a type of soft rubber with a lot of air in it, used in furniture

examples.text: a foam mattress

definition.text: a mass of very small bubbles on the surface of a liquid

meaning.translation: توده ای از حباب های ریز در سطح یک مایع

examples.text: The sea was covered in foam.

definition.text: a substance which is like a very thick soft liquid with a lot of bubbles in it

examples.text: Firefighters using water and foam are still tackling the blaze.
shaving foam

definition.text: to produce foam

examples.text: The green water splashed and foamed over the rocks.

definition.text:
a)to have bubbles coming out of your mouth because you are very ill
b)to be very angry
very cold weather, when water freezes

meaning.translation: هوای خیلی سرد به نحوی که آب یخ بزند

examples.text: late/early/first frost
Even in May we can sometimes get a late frost.
hard/heavy/sharp/severe frost(= extremely cold weather )
three continuous nights of hard frost
the risk of frost damage to crops

definition.text: ice that looks white and powdery and covers things that are outside when the temperature is very cold

examples.text: The grass and trees were white with frost.

definition.text: to cover a cake with a mixture of powdery sugar and liquid
to stop doing something, especially something that you do regularly

examples.text: Darren has decided to give up football at the end of this season.
She gave up her job and started writing poetry.
give up doing something
I gave up going to the theatre when I moved out of London.
Why don’t you give up smoking?

definition.text: to stop trying to do something

meaning.translation: تسلیم شدن ، دست از تلاش برداشتن

examples.text: We spent half an hour looking for the keys, but eventually gave up and went home.
I give up. What’s the answer?
You shouldn’t give up so easily .
give up doing something
I gave up trying to persuade him to continue with his studies.
give something ↔ up
She has still not given up the search.
The ground was too hard to dig so I gave it up as a bad job (= stopped trying because success seemed unlikely ) .

definition.text: to allow yourself or someone else to be caught by the police or enemy soldiers

examples.text: The siege ended peacefully after the gunman gave himself up.
give yourself/somebody up to
In the end, his family gave him up to the police.

definition.text: to use some of your time to do a particular thing

examples.text: I don’t mind giving up a couple of hours a week to deal with correspondence.

definition.text: to give something that is yours to someone else

examples.text: The family refused to give up any of their land.
She was put under tremendous pressure to give the baby up.
give something/somebody ↔ up to
I would always give my seat up to an elderly person on the bus.

definition.text: to end a romantic relationship with someone, even though you do not really want to

meaning.translation: تمام کردن یک رابطه رمانتیک اگرچه از صمیم قلب این را نخواهی

examples.text: I knew deep down that I should give him up.

definition.lexUnit: give somebody up for dead/lost etc
definition.text: to believe that someone is dead and stop looking for them

examples.text: The ship sank and the crew were given up for dead.

definition.text: used to ask people to applaud someone
a soft steady light

examples.text: glow from
the glow from the dying fire
glow of
the dim glow of the lightbulb
the warm glow of the setting sun
the green glow of the computer monitor

definition.text: the pink colour in your face or body that you have when you are healthy, have been doing exercise, or are excited

examples.text: She had a healthy glow in her cheeks.

definition.text: a strong feeling of pleasure etc

meaning.translation: یک حس شدید لذت ، رضایت و غیره

examples.text: Sophie felt a glow of pride.

definition.text: to produce or reflect a soft steady light

meaning.translation: ساطع کردن یا بازتاب کردن یک نور ثابت و ملایم

examples.text: The bedside lamp glowed dimly.
The fireplace was still glowing with the remains of last night’s fire.
The red tip of his cigarette was glowing in the dark.

definition.text: if your face or body glows, it is pink or hot because you are healthy, have been doing exercise, or are feeling a strong emotion

examples.text: glow with
She looked exceptionally well, glowing with health .

definition.text: to look very happy because you feel proud etc

examples.text: She gazed up at him, glowing with happiness.

definition.text: if something glows with a quality or colour, it is attractive and has strong colours

examples.text: glow with
The interior of the house glowed with colour, warmth, and life.

definition.text:
a) a bird that is like a duck but is larger and makes loud noises
b) a female goose
the cooked meat of this bird
a silly person
to touch or press someone on their bottom as a joke

a) to wait for a short time
b) used when you have just noticed, heard, or remembered something interesting or wrong
c) used to ask someone on the telephone to wait until the person they want to talk to is available

meaning.translation: آ) یه خرده صبر کردن ب) صبر کن ببینم (وقتی متوجه یه چیز جالب یا اشتباه شدی) ج) گوشی رو نگه داشتن

examples.text: Hold on, I’ll just get my coat.
Hold on a minute! Isn’t that your brother’s car over there?
Can you hold on? I’ll try to find her.

definition.text: to have your hands or arms tightly around something

examples.text: Hold on tight !
to
Hold on to my arm.

definition.text: to continue doing something that is very difficult to do

examples.text: San Francisco held on to win 4–2.

definition.text: lack of food, especially for a long period of time, that can cause illness or death

examples.text: die of/from hunger
Thousands of people are dying from hunger every day.

definition.text: the feeling that you need to eat

examples.text: Try to satisfy your hunger by eating some fruit.
hunger pangs(= sudden feelings of being hungry )

definition.text: a strong need or desire for something

examples.text: hunger for
her hunger for knowledge
a hunger for success

definition.text: used to say what you are writing or talking about, especially in business letters

examples.text: I am writing to you in reference to the job opening in your department.

definition.text: not feeling at all confident about yourself, your abilities, or your relationships with people

examples.text: insecure about
She’s very insecure about her appearance.
She felt lonely and insecure away from her family.

definition.text: a job, investment etc that is insecure does not give you a feeling of safety, because it might be taken away or lost at any time

examples.text: Many of them work in low-paid insecure jobs.

definition.text: a building or structure that is insecure is not safe, because it could fall down

a fairy tale (= old story for children ) about a boy called Jack who sells his mother ’s cow for some magic beans . His mother angrily throws these beans out of the window, but by the next day they have grown into a tall beanstalk (= the main stem of a bean plant ) . Jack climbs up it into the clouds, where he finds a giant 's castle . He enters it and finds a magic hen (= a female chicken ) that produces golden eggs . The giant notices Jack, saying ‘ Fee fi fo fum, I smell the blood of an Englishman ’, but Jack manages to escape, stealing the hen, and goes back down the beanstalk. The giant tries to follow him, but when Jack arrives back on the ground he cuts down the beanstalk, the giant falls and dies, and Jack becomes rich as a result of the golden eggs. In the UK, this story is often used in pantomime s .
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

examples.text: The trial judge specifies the number of years to be spent in prison.
federal judge/high court judge etc(= a judge in a particular court )

definition.text: someone who decides on the result of a competition

examples.text: The panel of judges included several well-known writers.

definition.text: someone whose opinion on something is usually right or wrong

meaning.translation: قضاوت یا تشخیص خوب/بد داشتن در مورد چیزی

examples.text: Sandra’s a very good judge of character.

definition.text: to be the person whose opinion on something matters or is accepted

examples.text: No one else can say what its value to you is – only you can be the judge of that.

definition.lexUnit: let me be the judge of that
definition.text: used to tell someone angrily that you do not need their advice
to make or have the power to make an important decision affecting someone by yourself – used showing disapproval
someone who is as sober as a judge is not drunk at all
to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them

examples.text: You should never judge a person by their looks.
Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge .
The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge .
We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.

definition.text: used to say that you are making a guess based on what you have just seen, heard, or learned

examples.text: Judging by his jovial manner, he must have enjoyed his meal.
Judging from what you say in your letter, you don’t sound well.

definition.text: to decide on the result of a competition

examples.text: I had the difficult task of judging the competition.
judge somebody on something
Competitors will be judged on speed and accuracy.

definition.text: to form an opinion about someone, especially in an unfair or criticizing way

examples.text: He just accepts people for what they are and he doesn’t judge them.

definition.text: to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime in court

definition.lexUnit: it’s not for somebody to judge
definition.text: used to say that you do not think someone has the right to give their opinion about something

meaning.translation: حق اظهار نظر نداره ، به او ربطی نداره

examples.text: Was it the right decision? It’s not for us to judge.

definition.lexUnit: as far as I can judge
definition.text: used to say that you think what you are saying is true, but you are not sure

meaning.translation: به نظر من ، اونطور که به نظر من میرسه

definition.lexUnit: don’t judge a book by its cover
definition.text: used to say that you should not form an opinion based only on the way something looks

meaning.translation: بر اساس ظاهر چیزی در موردش قضاوت نکن

definition.text: a small cupboard with a lock in a school, sports building, office etc, where you can leave clothes or possessions while you do something

meaning.translation: کمد (در مدرسه ، باشگاه ، اداره و غیره)

definition.text: a very cold room used for storing food in a restaurant or factory

examples.text: a meat locker

definition.text: a type of fruit like a peach that has a smooth skin, or the tree that produces this fruit
if a company or government has a monopoly of a business or political activity, it has complete control of it so that other organizations cannot compete with it

examples.text: monopoly of
They are demanding an end to the Communist Party’s monopoly of power .
the state monopoly of television
monopoly on/in
For years Bell Telephone had a monopoly on telephone services in the US.
a monopoly in copper trading

definition.text: a large company that controls all or most of a business activity

examples.text: The company is a state-owned monopoly.

definition.text: if someone has a monopoly on something, that thing belongs to them, and no one else can share it

examples.text: Teachers do not have a monopoly on educational debate.

definition.text: a very popular type of board game that has been sold since the 1930s. Players use toy money to buy streets and buildings on squares on the board, and then make other players pay rent if they move onto those squares. The squares on the board show the names of real streets in cities in the US (=in an American Monopoly set ), London (=in a British Monopoly set), or other big cities around the world. People sometimes use the expression Monopoly money to mean a very large amount of money

examples.text: You know how much it costs to buy an apartment in Tokyo? It's Monopoly money!

definition.text: to begin to sleep, usually when you do not intend to and are sitting somewhere

meaning.translation: به خواب رفتن (معمولاً در مورد وقتی که قصدش رو نداری یا جایی نشسته ای)

examples.text: I missed the movie because I kept nodding off.

definition.text: able to do everything
a medicine which reduces or removes pain

examples.text: an overdose of painkillers

definition.text: a soft food made from meat or fish, that you can spread on bread
a cheque that someone receives as payment for their wages

meaning.translation: چک دریافتی بابت حقوق یک شخص

examples.text: a weekly paycheque

definition.text: the amount of wages someone earns

meaning.translation: مقدار حقوقی که یک شخص دریافت می کند

examples.text: a nice fat paycheck

definition.text: a peaceful time, place, or situation is quiet and calm without any worry or excitement

meaning.translation: آرام ، ساکت و بدون نگرانی یا هیجان

examples.text: We had a peaceful afternoon without the children.
It’s very peaceful out here in the woods.

definition.text: not involving war, fighting, or violence

meaning.translation: در صلح (بدون جنگ ، درگیری یا خشونت)

examples.text: peaceful protest/demonstration
There was a large but peaceful demonstration outside the US Embassy.
peaceful solution/conclusion/settlement
We must try to find a peaceful solution to the conflict.
peaceful means/way/manner/method
a political change achieved by peaceful and democratic means
the use of nuclear power for peaceful purposes
The countries in Europe have established a peaceful co-existence (= they exist together without fighting ) .

definition.text: peaceful people do not like violence and do not behave in a violent way

examples.text: a noisy but peaceful group of demonstrators

definition.text:
a) a hole in the ground, especially one made by digging
b) a large hole in the ground from which stones or minerals are obtained by digging

meaning.translation: آ) حفره ای در زمین ، گودال ، چاله ب) محل حفاری زمین

examples.text: The female digs a pit in which to lay the eggs.
a five-foot deep pit
gravel/sand/chalk pit

definition.text: a coal mine

examples.text: Dad first went down the pit (= worked in a coal mine ) when he was 15 years old.
a national strike against pit closures

definition.text: a small hollow mark in the surface of something, especially on your skin as the result of a disease

examples.text: the deep pits left by smallpox

definition.text: a house or room that is dirty, untidy, or in bad condition

meaning.translation: خانه یا اتاقی که کثیف ، نامرتب یا در وضعیت بدی باشد

definition.text: to be extremely bad

examples.text: The company refused to pay – I think it’s the pits.

definition.lexUnit: in/at the pit of your stomach
definition.text: if you have a feeling in the pit of your stomach, you have a sick or tight feeling in your stomach, usually because you are nervous or afraid

examples.text: I had a feeling in the pit of my stomach that something terrible was going to happen.

definition.text: the place beside the track in a car race where cars can come in for petrol, new tyres etc
an orchestra pit
a hole in the floor of a garage that lets you get under a car to repair it

examples.text: an inspection pit

definition.text: a situation which makes you feel very bad

examples.text: Just thinking about the future plunged her into a pit of despair .

definition.text: the single large hard seed in some fruits

examples.text: a peach pit

definition.text: an armpit
the area of a stock exchange where people buy and sell shares
to put small marks or holes in the surface of something

examples.text: be pitted with something
The whole street was pitted with potholes.

definition.text: to take out the single hard seed inside some fruits

examples.text: Peel and pit two avocados.

definition.text: to stop in a car race to get petrol or have your car repaired
a single fact, idea, or opinion that is part of an argument or discussion

examples.text: That’s a very interesting point.
She made some extremely good points.
There are three important points we must bear in mind.
This brings me to my next point.
point about
I agree with John’s point about keeping the costs down.

definition.text: the most important fact or idea

examples.text: The point is, at least we’re all safely back home.
Nobody knows exactly how it works. That’s the whole point .
He may not have stolen the money himself, but that’s not the point .
I wish you’d get to the point (= talk about the most important thing ) .
I’ll come straight to the point (= talk about the most important thing first ) .
I need to find out who killed Alf, and more to the point (= what is more important ) I need to do it before anyone else gets killed.
We all like him, but that’s beside the point (= not the most important thing ) .
I think you’ve missed the point (= you have not understood the most important thing ) .

definition.text: the purpose or aim of something

examples.text: I suppose we could save one or two of the trees, but what’s the point?
point of
What’s the point of this meeting anyway?
The whole point of this legislation is to protect children.
There’s no point in worrying.
We’re going to lose anyway, so I can’t see the point of playing.
I didn’t see the point in moving to London.

definition.text: a particular place or position

examples.text: The accident happened at the point where the A15 joins the M1.
No cars are allowed beyond this point.
a border crossing point
Cairo is a convenient departure point for tours.
Dover is a point of entry into Britain.

definition.text: an exact moment, time, or stage in the development of something

meaning.translation: مقدار ، زمان ، مرحله یا سطح مشخص

examples.text: I had reached a point in my career where I needed to decide which way to go.
She had got to the point where she felt that she could not take any more.
Their win over old rivals Manchester United was the high point (= best part ) in their season.
Sales reached a low point in 1996.
We will take last week’s riots as a starting point for our discussion.
At one point, I thought he was going to burst into tears.
Maybe at this point we should move onto some of the practical experiments.
At that point, I was still living at home and had no job.
You will probably sell the car at some point in the future.
It is impossible to give a definite answer at this point in time .
Some children are bullied to the point of suicide (= until they reach this stage ) .

definition.text: a particular quality or feature that something or someone has

examples.text: somebody’s/something’s good/bad points
Sometimes she had to remind herself of his good points.
point of(= small details about qualities and features )
They would spend hours discussing the finer points (= small details about qualities and features ) of various cars.
The low price is one of its main selling points (= features that will help to sell it ) .
Driving was not one of Baxter’s strong points .
One of the club’s plus points is that it is central.
There were some weak points in his argument.

definition.text: one of the marks or numbers that shows your score in a game or sport

examples.text: He is three points behind the leader.
Leeds United are now six points clear at the top of the table.
She had to win this point .
You get three points for a win and one point for a draw.
You lose a point if you do not complete the puzzle on time.
The fight went the full fifteen rounds, and in the end the American won on points .

definition.text: a sharp end of something

examples.text: the sharp point of a spear

definition.text: the temperature at which something boils, freezes, melts etc

meaning.translation: نقطه ، دما (جوش ، انجماد ، ذوب و غیره)

examples.text: Heat the water until it reaches boiling point.

definition.text: a stage in a process or activity when it becomes impossible to stop it or do something different

examples.text: reach/pass the point of no return
I was aware that we had passed the point of no return.

definition.text: an idea which you use to start a discussion

examples.text: He takes the idea of personal freedom as his point of departure.

definition.lexUnit: be on the point of (doing) something
definition.text: to be going to do something very soon

examples.text: I was on the point of giving up the search when something caught my eye in the bushes.
The country’s economy is on the point of collapse.

definition.text: partly, but not completely

examples.text: I agree with you up to a point.
That is true, but only up to a point.

definition.text: dealing only with the important subject or idea, and not including any unnecessary discussions

examples.text: Her comments were brief and to the point.

definition.lexUnit: make a point of doing something
definition.text: to do something deliberately, even when it involves making a special effort

examples.text: He made a point of spending Saturdays with his children.
I always make a point of being early.

definition.lexUnit: when/if it comes to the point
definition.text: used to talk about what happens when someone is in a difficult situation and has to make a difficult decision

examples.text: I’m sure that if it came to the point, he would do what is expected of him.

definition.text: used when saying that something is true, although it may seem unlikely

examples.text: We were assured that the prisoners were being well treated, when in point of fact they were living in terrible conditions.

definition.lexUnit: not to put too fine a point on it
definition.text: used when you are criticizing something in a plain and direct way

examples.text: The restaurant was terrible, not to put too fine a point on it.
She’s lying, not to put too fine a point on it.

definition.text: a sign (.) used to separate a whole number from any decimals that follow it

meaning.translation: نقطه (که بخش صحیح یک عدد را از بخش اعشاری آن جدا می کند)

definition.text: a mark or measure on a scale

examples.text: The stock market has fallen by over 200 points in the last week.

definition.text: a very small spot of light or colour

examples.text: The stars shone like points of light in the sky.

definition.text: one of the marks on a compass that shows direction

examples.text: Soldiers were advancing on us from all points of the compass.

definition.text: a long thin piece of land that stretches out into the sea

examples.text: We sailed round the point into a small, sheltered bay.

definition.text: a piece of plastic with holes in it which is attached to a wall and to which electrical equipment can be connected

examples.text: a telephone point
an electrical point

definition.text: a piece of railway track that can be moved to allow a train to cross over from one track to another

examples.text: The train rattled over the points.

definition.text: to show something to someone by holding up one of your fingers or a thin object towards it

examples.text: ‘Look!’ she said and pointed.
point at
I could see him pointing at me and telling the other guests what I had said.
point to/towards
She was pointing to a small boat that was approaching the shore.
point with
The driver pointed with his whip.
She pointed in the direction of the car park.
He stood up and pointed his finger at me.

definition.text: to hold something so that it is aimed towards a person or thing

examples.text: point something at somebody/something
He stood up and pointed his gun at the prisoner.
She produced a camera and pointed it at me.

definition.text: to face or be aimed in a particular direction

meaning.translation: نشانه رفتن ، در جهت خاصی بودن ، رو به جهت خاصی بودن

examples.text: The arrow always points north.
There were flashlights all around us, pointing in all directions.
point at
There were TV cameras pointing at us.
point to/towards
The hands of the clock pointed to a quarter past one.
We found footprints pointing towards the back door.

definition.text: to show someone which direction they should go in

meaning.translation: راه را نشان دادن ، راهنمایی کردن

examples.text: She pointed me towards an armchair.
Could you point me in the direction of the bathroom, please?

definition.text: to suggest what someone should do

meaning.translation: راهنمایی کردن ، راه را نشان دادن

examples.text: My teachers were all pointing me towards university.
A financial adviser should be able to point you in the right direction .

definition.text: to suggest that something is true

examples.text: Everything seemed to point in one direction.
point to/towards
All the evidence pointed towards Blake as the murderer.
Everything points to her having died from a drugs overdose.

definition.text: to put new cement between the bricks of a wall
to stretch the ends of your feet downwards
to blame someone or say that they have done something wrong

examples.text: I knew that they would point the finger at me.
I don’t want to point a finger of blame at anyone.

definition.text:
a)to show the direction that something is in
b)to show how something could change or develop successfully

examples.text: point the way to/towards
An old-fashioned signpost pointed the way to the restaurant.
point the way forward/forwards
This report points the way forward for the water industry.
point the way to/towards
a government paper which points the way towards reform

definition.text: a difficult or unpleasant situation in which you do not know what to do, or in which you have to make a difficult choice

meaning.translation: یک موقعیت سخت یا نامطلوب که نمی دونی چیکار باید کنی یا مجبوری تصمیم صختی بگیری

examples.text: the country’s economic predicament
She went to the office to explain her predicament .
in a predicament
Other married couples are in a similar predicament.

definition.text: work that is done by students on their own, after classes have finished – used in private schools

inflections: ( past participle prepped, present participle prepping )
title: prep_verb_1

definition.text: to prepare someone for an operation or an examination

meaning.translation: آماده کردن کسی برای عمل جراحی یا معاینه پزشکی

inflections: ( past participle prepped, present participle prepping )
title: prep_verb_2

definition.text: to prepare food for cooking in a restaurant

meaning.translation: آماده کردن مواد اولیه غذا در یک رستوران

inflections: ( past participle prepped, present participle prepping )
title: prep_verb_3

definition.text: to prepare for something that you are going to do

examples.text: I have to prep for my afternoon class.

definition.text: the written abbreviation of preposition
preppy clothes or styles are very neat, in a way that is typical of students who go to expensive private schools in the US
to help something to develop or increase

examples.text: a meeting to promote trade between Taiwan and the UK
Fertilizer promotes leaf growth.

definition.text: to give someone a better more responsible job in a company

examples.text: promote somebody to something
Helen was promoted to senior manager.

definition.text: to help sell a new product, film etc by offering it at a reduced price or by advertising it

examples.text: She’s in London to promote her new book.

definition.text: if a sports team is promoted, they play in a better group of teams the next year

examples.text: be promoted to something
They have been promoted to the First Division.

definition.text: to try to persuade people to support or use something

examples.text: John Major promoted the idea of a classless society.

definition.text: to be responsible for arranging a large public event such as a concert or a sports game
a hard flat circular piece of rubber that you hit with the stick in the game of ice hockey
a character who enjoys playing tricks on people in the play A Midsummer Night's Dream by William Shakespeare
a tropical forest with tall trees that are very close together, growing in an area where it rains a lot

meaning.translation: یک جنگل گرمسیری با درختان انبوه در جایی که باران زیادی می بارد

examples.text: the destruction of the rain forest

definition.text: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation

examples.text: Teachers reassured anxious parents.
reassure somebody (that)
He tried to reassure me that my mother would be okay.

definition.text: to play roughly or pretend to fight

meaning.translation: خشن بازی کردن ، ادای دعوا کردن درآوردن

examples.text: Okay, guys, slow down. No more roughhousing.

definition.text: a strong alcoholic drink made from sugar, or a glass of this drink
unusual or strange
to have sex with someone, especially someone you are not married to

examples.text: Everybody in the office knows he’s been sleeping with Kathy.

definition.text: a children’s party when a group of children sleep at one child’s house
to sleep
sleep

examples.text: He passed into a deep slumber.

word: somebody sees the glass as half-empty/half-full
title: somebody sees the glass as half-empty/half-full

definition.text: used to say that a particular person is more likely to notice the good parts or the bad parts of a situation
a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers

examples.text: celery stalks

definition.text: a thin upright object

definition.lexUnit: somebody’s eyes are out on stalks
definition.text: if your eyes are out on stalks, you are very surprised or shocked

meaning.translation: چشم های کسی از حدقه بیرون زدن (خیلی تعجب کردن یا شوک شدن)

definition.text: to follow a person or animal quietly in order to catch and attack or kill them

meaning.translation: بی سر و صدا دنبال انسانی یا حیوانی رفتن برای گرفتن ، حمله یا کشتن اون

examples.text: a tiger stalking its prey
We know the rapist stalks his victims at night.

definition.text: to follow and watch someone over a long period of time in a way that is very annoying or threatening, and that is considered a crime in some places

examples.text: She was stalked by an obsessed fan.

definition.text: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps

examples.text: stalk out/off/away
Yvonne turned and stalked out of the room in disgust.

definition.text: if something bad stalks a place, you see or feel it everywhere in that place

examples.text: Fear stalks every dark stairwell and walkway.

definition.text: to make someone stop thinking and worrying about something

meaning.translation: کاری کنی که شخصی دست از فکر کردن یا نگران بودن در مورد چیزی برداره

examples.text: Going back to work helped take my mind off Ian’s death.
Want a game? It might take your mind off things .

definition.text: the people who live in a village

examples.text: The whole village came to the meeting.

definition.text: to rest or do something different from your usual job or activities

meaning.translation: استراحت کردن ، کار متفاوتی غیر از شغل یا فعالیت های معمول انجام دادن

examples.text: In between jobs, Liz always took time out to return to her first love – travelling.

definition.text: a short break during a sports match when the teams can rest, get instructions from their manager etc

examples.text: With 15.7 seconds left, Washington State called time out .

definition.text: an occasion when a computer stops using a particular program because the user has not done any work for a period of time
a weekly London listings magazine which gives details of all the films, plays, sports games, and other events and activities taking place in the city. It is read especially by young people.
a small tool that has two narrow pieces of metal joined at one end, used to pull or move very small objects

examples.text: She was plucking her eyebrows with a pair of tweezers.

definition.text: someone you love or think is attractive, that you send a card to on St Valentine’s Day

meaning.translation: شخصی که عاشقشی یا به نظرت جذابه و روز ولنتاین براش یه کارت می فرستی

examples.text: Be my valentine.

definition.text: a card you send to someone on St Valentine’s Day

meaning.translation: کارتی که روز ولنتاین برای کسی می فرستی

definition.text: a container used to put flowers in or for decoration
someone who does not eat meat or fish

examples.text: Our youngest daughter is a vegetarian.
dishes suitable for vegetarians
I’m thinking about becoming a vegetarian.

definition.text: a method that you use to do or achieve something

examples.text: There are several different ways we can tackle this problem.
way of doing something
Evening classes are one way of meeting new people.
There’s no way of knowing if the treatment will work.
way to do something
What’s the best way to learn a language?
in the same way/in various ways
Make the drink with boiling water in the same way as tea.
Animals communicate in various ways.
(in) the right/wrong way
I think you’re going about this the wrong way .
ways and means(= methods of doing something, especially ones that are secret or not yet decided )
There are ways and means of raising the money that we need.
way out/out of/around(= method of dealing with it )
One way around the problem (= method of dealing with it ) is recycling.
There seems to be no way out of the current economic crisis.
way into television/publishing/finance etc(= a method of getting involved in a particular activity or type of work )
companies eager for a way into business in Europe

definition.text: the manner or style in which someone does something or in which something happens

examples.text: Look at the way he’s dressed!
in a ... way
‘Hello, ’ he said in a friendly way.
Maria got up and took a shower in a leisurely way.
(in) this/that way(= like this ) (= had that feeling or opinion )
I find it easier to work in this way (= like this ) .
Sorry, I didn’t know you felt that way (= had that feeling or opinion ) .
The drugs didn’t seem to affect Anna in the same way .
that’s no way to do something(= used to tell someone that they should not be doing something in a particular manner )
That’s no way to speak to your father!
in more ways than one(= in a number of ways )
The changes will benefit the company in more ways than one.
in somebody’s (own) way(= in a personal way that other people may not recognize )
I’m sure he does love you, in his own way.

definition.text:
a) a road, path, direction etc that you take in order to get to a particular place
b) a particular direction from where you are now

examples.text: the way to/from/out etc
Which is the quickest way to the sea from here?
There are several ways through the woods.
ask/tell/show somebody the way
Could you tell me the way to the station?
Does anyone know the way from here?
I was afraid of losing my way in the dark.
Can you find your way back to the car park?
the way out(= the door, path etc which you can use to leave a building or area )
Which is the way out?
the way in(= the door, path etc which you can use to enter a building or area )
She looked all around, but she couldn’t seem to find the way in.
on somebody’s way(= in the same direction as someone is going )
Want a lift? It’s on my way.
out of somebody’s way(= not in the same direction as someone is going )
I live miles out of your way.
Which way is north?
Walk this way .
A big Mercedes was coming the other way (= from the opposite direction ) .
He left the house, looking carefully both ways.

definition.text: used to say that there is a fact or a feature of something that makes a statement or description true

examples.text: in a/one way
In one way you’re right, I suppose.
in some/many ways
Working at home makes sense, in many ways.
Ben is a perfectly normal child in every way .
He never got mad at me. He was great in that way .
in no way(= used to emphasize that something is not true )
This should in no way be seen as a defeat.

definition.text: a distance or a length of time, especially a long one

meaning.translation: فاصله یا زمان (به ویژه یک فاصله یا زمان خیلی طولانی)

examples.text: I was still a long way from home.
some way/quite a way(= quite a long distance )
She had to park some way from the restaurant.
a long way off/away/ahead etc(= far away in distance or in time )
A peace settlement now seems a long way off.
I don’t want to go all that way and not see him.
all the way down/across/through etc (something)(= the full distance or length of something )
Did you really swim all the way across?
a (long) ways
That’s quite a ways from here, isn’t it?

definition.text: if someone or something is in the way, they are blocking the space in front of you, and you cannot move forward

meaning.translation: سد راه (به معنی مسیر کسی را بستن)

examples.text: be in the way/be in somebody’s way(= be blocking a road, someone’s path etc so that they cannot move forward easily )
There was a big truck in the way.
Sorry, am I in your way?
A policeman yelled at the crowds to get out of the way .

definition.text:
a)to move to the side so that there is space for someone or something to pass
b)to make it possible for something newer or better to be built, organized etc

examples.text: The crowd stepped aside to make way for the procession.
Several houses were demolished to make way for a new road.

definition.text:
a) an out-of-the-way place is in an area where there are few people b) unusual or strange c)if someone or something is out of the way, they are somewhere where they are not likely to cause a problem, need attention, be annoying etc
d) if a particular matter, job etc is out of the way, it has been done or dealt with

meaning.translation: آ) دور افتاده ب) غیرمعمول ، عجیب و غریب ج) از سر راه برداشته (به معنی اینکه مشکل برطرف شده و نیازی به نگرانی نیست ) د) برطرف شده (در مورد مسئله یا مشکل)

examples.text: an out-of-the-way spot for a picnic
It’s a great little pub, but a bit out of the way.
Her taste in music is a bit out-of-the-way.
move/put/push etc something out of the way
Why don’t you tie your hair back, out of the way?
If Uncle Tom had been drinking, I kept out of his way .
When Mac was safely out of the way, Peter came round.
I’d rather get the interview out of the way in the morning.
As soon as the contract’s out of the way, we can start.

definition.text:
a)arriving or happening soon
b)travelling towards a particular place
c)while going from one place to another
d)while moving from one situation or part of your life to another
e)if someone has a baby on the way, they are pregnant

examples.text: There’s a letter on its way to you.
More changes are on the way.
She should be on the way here by now.
on the/your/its way to
The ships were already on their way to the gulf
on the/your/its way to/out/home etc
I ran out of gas on my way to the airport.
Guess who I bumped into on the way home.
Don’s had to change jobs several times along the way.

definition.text:
a)to have started to happen or be done
b)to have started to move or travel somewhere

examples.text: Plans are well under way for a new shopping centre.
The tournament got under way on Friday.
Our train was already under way.

definition.text:
a)to go towards something, especially when this is difficult or takes a long time
b)to gradually become successful in a particular job, activity, profession etc

examples.text: make your way to/through/towards etc
The team slowly made their way back to base.
make your own way (home/to something etc)(= go somewhere without the help or company of other people )
Don’t worry. I can make my own way to the beach.
young people who are making their way in industry

definition.text: to get somewhere by using force or moving carefully

examples.text: She elbowed her way to the front of the queue.
He drank some water, then groped his way back to the bedroom.

definition.text:
a)to be replaced by something else
b)to agree to do what someone else wants, instead of what you want, especially after a lot of discussion or argument
c)to break because of too much weight or pressure
d)to stop or slow down when you are driving, in order to allow other vehicles to go first

meaning.translation: آ) جایگزین شدن ب) تسلیم شدن ، به چیزی تن دادن ج) شکستن بخاطر تحمل وزن یا فشار زیاد د) راه دادن (در رانندگی به معنی به بقیه خودرو ها اجازه اول رفتن دادن)

examples.text: give way to
Stone has given way to glass and concrete.
My anger gave way to depression.
Despite growing pressure, the Minister of State refused to give way.
give way to
Maria seemed to despise him for giving way to her.
The floor’s rotten and likely to give way.
In Britain, give way to cars coming from the right.

definition.text: to make it possible for something to happen or develop later

meaning.translation: راه را باز کردن یا هموار کردن برای چیزی (به معنی : اتفاق افتادن یا رشد چیزی را ممکن کردن)

examples.text: a study that paved the way for further research
The Queen’s death opened the way for him to return.

definition.text: an action, plan etc that seems a good idea because it is likely to lead to success

examples.text: A way forward lies in developing more economic links.
a/the way forward for
This treatment may be the way forward for many inherited disorders.

definition.text: a particular state or condition

examples.text: My family was in a bad way financially.
The chicken’s nice and crispy – just the way I like it .
It’s worth thinking how you can improve the way things are .
somebody was born/made that way(= used to say that someone’s character is not likely to change )
He’ll always be mean – he was born that way.

definition.text: used to refer to something that happens

examples.text: I hate the way you always give in to him.

definition.text: someone’s typical style of behaving, especially when it seems different or unusual

examples.text: be (just) somebody’s way
Don’t worry if she’s quiet – that’s just her way.
Esther quickly changed the subject, as was her way .
strange/funny/odd etc ways
We all have our funny little ways.
change/mend your ways(= stop behaving badly )

definition.text: used in expressions about developing and improving

examples.text: The team has a long way to go (= needs to develop or improve a lot ) before it can match that performance.
Microwave ovens have come a long way (= have developed or improved a lot ) since they first appeared in our kitchens.
Jen is now well on the way to recovery (= she has improved and will be well soon ) .

definition.lexUnit: go some way towards doing something
definition.text: to help a little or a lot to make something happen

examples.text: ideas that go some way towards reducing environmental problems

definition.text: used when talking about two choices someone could make, or two possibilities that could happen

examples.text: I’m not sure which way he’ll decide.
The election could go either way (= both results are equally possible ) .
Make your mind up one way or the other .
either way(= used to say that something will be the same, whichever of two things happens )
Either way, it’s going to be expensive.

definition.lexUnit: within two feet/ten years etc either way
definition.text: no more than two feet etc more or less than a particular amount

examples.text: Your answer must be within a centimetre either way.

definition.lexUnit: (in) one way or another/one way or the other
definition.text: used to say that someone does or will do something somehow, although you are not sure how

meaning.translation: به هر نحوی ، به هر شکلی

examples.text: One way or the other he always seems to win.
We’ll find the money, one way or another.

definition.text: a particular order or position that something should be in

examples.text: Which way around does this skirt go?
the other way around/round/up(= in the opposite order or position ) (= is it ‘life reflects art’ )
The picture should be the other way up.
Art reflects life, or is it the other way around (= is it ‘life reflects art’ ) ?
the right/wrong way around/round/up
Are the batteries in the wrong way round?

definition.text:
a)as a form or means of something
b)if you travel by way of a place, you go through it

examples.text: I’d like to say something by way of introduction.
little in the way of something not much/enough in the way of something )(= not much of something )
The town has little in the way of leisure facilities.
We went by way of London.

definition.lexUnit: get in the way of something
definition.text: to prevent someone from doing something, or prevent something from happening

meaning.translation: جلوگیری کردن از کسی یا چیزی

examples.text: Your social life must not get in the way of your studies.

definition.lexUnit: go out of your way to do something
definition.text: to do something with more effort than is usual or expected

examples.text: She went out of her way to make me feel welcome.

definition.text: to do what you want to, even though someone else wants something different

meaning.translation: هر کاری دلت می خواد انجام دادن

examples.text: Don’t let the children always get their own way.

definition.text: to do what you want, make your own decisions etc

meaning.translation: راه خود را رفتن (به معنی : اون چیزی که می خوای رو انجام بدی ، خودت در مورد زندگی خودت تصمیم بگیری و غیره)

examples.text: At 18, most young people are ready to go their own way.

definition.text:
a)if an event goes your way, it happens in the way you want
b)to continue a journey, or to leave and do what you want to do next
c)to travel in the same direction as someone

examples.text: The government are hopeful that the vote will go their way.
everything/nothing goes somebody’s way(= used to talk about events in general )
She said goodbye and went her way.
I can take you – I’m going your way.

definition.text: if something comes your way, you get or experience it, especially by chance

examples.text: Luck had come her way at the very last moment.

definition.text: used to talk about the degree to which something happens, or how important it is

examples.text: The business was a success, in a small way.

definition.text: by a large amount

examples.text: He was the best in the group by a long way.

definition.lexUnit: talk/buy etc your way into/past etc something/somebody
definition.text: to get where you want or achieve something you want by saying or doing something

meaning.translation: به خواسته خود رسیدن با گفتن چیزی یا انجام کاری

examples.text: Caroline managed to talk her way past the guard.

definition.lexUnit: work/munch/smoke etc your way through something
definition.text: to deal with, eat, smoke etc a large amount of things

examples.text: He worked his way through the pile of documents.
She had munched her way through a packet of biscuits.

definition.text: to be becoming less popular, important, powerful etc

examples.text: Is the royal family on the way out?

definition.text: on the opposite side of the street

examples.text: They live across the way from us at number 23.

definition.lexUnit: have a way of doing something
definition.text: used to say that something often or usually happens

examples.text: Cheer up – these problems have a way of working out.

definition.lexUnit: get into the way of doing something
definition.text: to start to do something regularly

examples.text: He’d got into the way of smoking first thing in the morning.

definition.lexUnit: not in any way, shape, or form
definition.text: used to emphasize that something is not true

examples.text: I am not responsible for his actions in any way, shape, or form.

definition.text: to divide something into two, three etc equal parts

examples.text: We’ll split the cost between us five ways.

definition.text: to be especially good at dealing with people or things of a particular type

meaning.translation: قلق کسی یا چیزی را بلد بودن

examples.text: David seems to have a way with children.
She’s always had a way with words (= been good at using words effectively ) .

definition.text: how things always happen or are done, especially when this is not easy to change

examples.text: In those days these policies favoured men. That was the way of the world.

definition.text:
a)in all directions
b)every possible method

examples.text: The kids ran off every which way.
Bullets were flying every which way.
I tried every which way to avoid it.

definition.text: used when saying something that is not related to the main subject you were talking about before

examples.text: By the way, have you seen my keys anywhere?

definition.text:
a) used to emphasize that you will not agree or be able to do something
 b) used to say that you will definitely not do or allow something
c) used to say that you do not believe something or are very surprised by it

examples.text: ‘Are you going to offer to work over the weekend?’ ‘No way!’
No way will we be finished by five o'clock.
There’s no way I’m going to pay £500 just for a weekend in Paris.
‘Can I borrow your car?’ ‘No way!’
There’s no way I’ll ever get married again.
No way José!(= used to emphasize that you will not do something )
She’s 45? No way!

definition.text: used before telling someone your opinion

examples.text: The way I see it, it was a fair trade.

definition.text: used to tell someone that they are doing something correctly or well, especially when you are showing them how

examples.text: Now bring your foot gently off the clutch – that’s the way.

definition.lexUnit: that’s (just) the way something/somebody is/that’s (just) the way something goes
definition.text: used to say that a particular situation or person cannot be changed

examples.text: Don’t try to fight it. That’s just the way it is.
Sometimes Tim needs to be alone. That’s the way he is.

definition.lexUnit: be with somebody all the way
definition.text: to agree with someone completely

examples.text: I’m with you all the way on this salary issue, Joe.

definition.text: used when telling someone what you think it would be best to do

examples.text: If I had my way, we’d leave this place tomorrow.

definition.text: used to tell someone in an annoyed way that you will agree to what they want

definition.lexUnit: (there are) no two ways about it
definition.text: used to say that something is definitely true, especially something unpleasant

definition.lexUnit: you can’t have it both ways
definition.text: used to say that you cannot have the advantages from both of two different possible decisions or actions

meaning.translation: نمی تونی هم خدا رو بخوای هم خرما رو

examples.text: It’s a choice between the time and the money – you can’t have it both ways!

definition.text: used to tell someone that they have done something very well or achieved something special
used to say that things always happen in the way that is least convenient

examples.text: The train was late – always the way when you’re in a hurry!

definition.text: in your area, the area of London etc
to have sex with someone
very far

examples.text: way ahead/behind/out etc
The other cyclists were way behind.
She lives way out of town.

definition.text: by a large amount

examples.text: way above/below/past etc
Her IQ is way above average.
way out(= completely incorrect )
Your guess was way out (= completely incorrect ), he’s actually thirty-eight.
way back(= a long time ago )
We first met way back (= a long time ago ) in the seventies.
way heavier/smarter/bigger etc(= much heavier etc )
The tickets were way more expensive than I thought.

definition.text: very

examples.text: I think she’s way cool, man.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle wept / wept / )
title: weep_verb_1

f2n.heading: Register
f2n.explanation: In everyday English, people usually say cry rather than weep :
examples: She was crying all the way through the movie.

definition.text: to cry, especially because you feel very sad

examples.text: James broke down and wept.
weep for
She wept for the loss of her mother.
He wept bitterly (= cried a lot ) when it was time for us to leave.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle wept / wept / )
title: weep_verb_2

definition.text: used to say that you felt very disappointed about something

examples.text: I could have wept thinking what I’d missed.

inflections: ( past tense and past participle wept / wept / )
title: weep_verb_3

definition.text: if a wound weeps, liquid comes out of it
a wiping movement with a cloth

examples.text: An occasional wipe with a soft cloth will keep the surface shiny.
Give the baby’s nose a wipe, would you?

definition.text: a special piece of wet material that you use to clean someone or something and then throw away

examples.text: a pack of baby wipes

definition.text:
a) to rub a surface with something in order to remove dirt, liquid etc
b) to clean something by rubbing it against a surface

examples.text: wipe something with something
Wipe the table with a damp cloth.
Bill wiped his eyes (= wiped the tears from his face ) and apologized.
He pulled a handkerchief from his pocket and wiped his nose .

definition.text: to remove liquid, dirt, or marks by wiping

examples.text: wipe something off/from etc something
Kim wiped the sweat from her face.

definition.text: to remove all the information that is stored on a tape, video, or computer disk
to try to forget an unpleasant experience

meaning.translation: پاک کردن چیزی از ذهن/حافظه (به معنی : فراموش کردن)

definition.text: to defeat someone completely in a competition or argument
to agree to forget about mistakes or arguments that happened in the past

definition.lexUnit: wipe the smile/grin off somebody’s face
definition.text: to make someone feel less happy or confident, especially someone who is annoying because they think they are clever

examples.text: Tell him how much it’ll cost – that should wipe the smile off his face!

definition.lexUnit: wipe something off the face of the earth/wipe something off the map
definition.text: to destroy something completely

meaning.translation: از رو زمین پاک کردن ، از رو نقشه پاک کردن (به معنی : نابود کردن)

examples.text: Another few years and this species could be wiped off the face of the earth.

definition.text: to dry plates, cups etc that have been washed

examples.text: You wash, I’ll wipe.

definition.text: a short form of ‘am not’, ‘is not’, ‘are not’, ‘has not’, or ‘have not’, that many people think is incorrect
a piece of clothing that covers the front part of your clothes and is tied around your waist, worn to keep your clothes clean, especially while cooking
the relationship between a child and its mother, especially if the mother controls an adult son or daughter too much

examples.text: You’re 25 years old, and you still haven’t cut the apron strings .
Jeff is still tied to his mother’s apron strings .

definition.text: the hard surface in an airport on which planes are turned around, loaded, unloaded etc
the part of the stage in a theatre that is in front of the curtain
